New Records: Fakhar Zaman scored 126 not out, his 11th ODI hundred, and first in a World Cup
Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra scored 108, his third ton of the World Cup
Hasan Ali dismissed Devon Conway for 35
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam's decision to bowl first raised some eyebrows
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam credited Fakhar Zaman for his performance
Kane Williamson acknowledged Fakhar Zaman's exceptional knock
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan and New Zealand both have eight points and remain in contention for semifinal spots
Rachin Ravindra, born in Wellington to Indian parents from Bengaluru, delighted the local fans
Others: The game was called off due to rain, with Pakistan declared the winners as they were ahead of the required rate
The match was played at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru
